sen.j: 日本神話（にほんしんわ）とは日本に伝わる神話のことである。
sen.e: Japanese mythology is a collection of myths that have been passed down in Japan.
sen.cmt: 原文にはありませんが a collection of という表現方法を使いました。
sen.e: Japanese mythology is a collection of myths that have been passed down in Japan.
Japanese mythology is a collection of myths that have been passed down in Japan.

sen.j: 序説
sen.e: Introduction
Introduction
Introduction

sen.j: 現在、日本神話と呼ばれる伝承はそのほとんどが『古事記』、『日本書紀』および地方各国の『風土記』にみられる記述をもとにしている。
sen.e: Most of the lore currently known as Japanese mythology are based on the descriptions that appear in "The Kojiki" (Records of Ancient Matters), "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Fudoki" (Ancient records of culture and the land) from various provinces.

Most of the lore currently known as Japanese mythology are based on the descriptions that appear in "The Kojiki" (Records of Ancient Matters), "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Fudoki" (Ancient records of culture and the land) from various provinces.

Most of the lore currently known as Japanese mythology is based on the descriptions that appear in "The Kojiki" (Records of Ancient Matters), "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Fudoki" (Ancient records of culture and the land) from various provinces.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: すなわち、高天原の神々を中心とする神話がその大半を占め、一方ではその出典となる文献は決して多くはない。
sen.e: That is, while myths featuring the gods of Takamanohara (Plain of High Heaven) form the majority, references on their origins are not many.
That is, while myths featuring the gods of Takamanohara (Plain of High Heaven) form the majority, references on their origins are not many.
The myths mainly feature the gods of Takamanohara (Plain of High Heaven) but there are not many original references.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 本来、日本各地にはそれぞれの形で何らかの信仰や伝承があったと思われ、その代表として出雲が登場する
sen.e: In general, it is considered that various parts of Japan have beliefs and lore of some kind that have been passed down in their respective forms, with Izumo appearing as the representative of such.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In general, it is considered that various parts of Japan have beliefs and lore of some kind that have been passed down in their respective forms, with Izumo appearing as the representative of such.
In general, it is considered that various parts of Japan have beliefs and lore of some kind that have been passed down in their respective forms, with Izumo as the representative of such lore.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、ヤマト王権の支配が広がるにつれてそのいずれもが国津神（くにつかみ）または「奉ろわぬ神」という形に変えられて「高天原神話」の中に統合されるに至ったと考えられている。
sen.e: However, it is considered that they were altered to fit the form of Kunitsu kami (gods of the lands) or '奉ろわぬ神' with the spread of Yamato sovereignty, and they were finally integrated into 'Takamanohara Mythology.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「奉ろわぬ神」読み方不明
sen.e: However, it is considered that they were altered to fit the form of Kunitsu kami (gods of the lands) or '奉ろわぬ神' with the spread of Yamato sovereignty, and they were finally integrated into 'Takamanohara Mythology.'

However, it is considered that they were altered to fit the form of Kunitsu kami (gods of the lands) or Matsurowanu kami (gods that do not obey) with the spread of Yamato sovereignty, and they were finally integrated into 'Takamanohara Mythology.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、後世までヤマト王権などの日本の中央権力の支配を受けなかったアイヌや琉球にはそれぞれ独自色の強い神話が存在する。
sen.e: However, there exist their own unique myths among the Ainu and the people of Ryukyu, who were not under the control of central Japanese authority, such as the Yamato sovereignty, until later periods.
However, there exist their own unique myths among the Ainu and the people of Ryukyu, who were not under the control of central Japanese authority, such as the Yamato sovereignty, until later periods.
However, among the Ainu and the people of Ryukyu, who were not under the control of central Japanese authority such as the Yamato sovereignty until later periods, their own unique myths exist.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 中世に入ると、『太平記』などの軍記物、歌学書やその注釈、寺社縁起などにおいて『日本書紀』にもとづきながらその内容に大きな差異が認められる、いわゆる中世神話（中世日本紀）が発達した。
sen.e: During the Middle Ages, the so-called Medieval Mythology (Chusei Nihongi) developed, including military epics such as "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace), Kagakusho (books on the study of waka poems) and commentaries on them, as well as the origins of temples and shrines, which were based on "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan) yet differ greatly in content.

During the Middle Ages, the so-called Medieval Mythology (Chusei Nihongi) developed, including military epics such as "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace), Kagakusho (books on the study of waka poems) and commentaries on them, as well as the origins of temples and shrines, which were based on "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan) yet differ greatly in content.

During the Middle Ages, the so-called Medieval Mythology (Chusei Nihongi) developed, including military epics such as "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace), Kagakusho (books on the study of waka poems) and commentaries on them, as well as the origins of temples and shrines, which were based on "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan) yet differ greatly in content.

sen.j: 中世神話のなかでは本地垂迹説にもとづいて記紀の神々が仏教の尊格と同一視されたり、あるいは対等に渡り合っている。
sen.e: In medieval mythology, some of the gods in Kiki (The Kojiki and Nihon Shoki) based on the theory of original reality and manifested traces are identified as or treated as equals to the deities in Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 用語集に「尊格」は Tang とされてますが、間違いだと思います。
sen.e: In medieval mythology, some of the gods in Kiki (The Kojiki and Nihon Shoki) based on the theory of original reality and manifested traces are identified as or treated as equals to the deities in Buddhism.

In medieval mythology, some of the gods in Kiki (The Kojiki and Nihon Shoki) are identified as or treated as equals to the deities in Buddhism based on the theory of Honjisuijyaku (gods are a manifestation of Buddha).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 記紀にはみられない神格やアイテムが登場したり、地方神話、民間伝承や芸能から取り込まれた要素が神話の中に混ざりこんでいたりすることもある。
sen.e: It often contains divinities and items not seen in Kiki, and elements from regional myths and folklores and entertainment may be mixed into it.
It often contains divinities and items not seen in Kiki, and elements from regional myths and folklores and entertainment may be mixed into it.
It often contains divinities and items not seen in Kiki, and elements from regional myths and folklores and entertainment may be mixed into it.

sen.j: 記紀神話とは異なり最後まで正統的な文献が存在しなかったため、豊富なバリエーションが多く残されている。
sen.e: Unlike the myths in Kiki, legitimate references never existed, and therefore, rich variations exist.
Unlike the myths in Kiki, legitimate references never existed, and therefore, rich variations exist.
Unlike the myths in Kiki, legitimate references never existed, and therefore, rich variations exist.

sen.j: 中世神話は現在ではおもに国文学方面で研究がおこなわれており、神話学などではあまりあつかわれていない。
sen.e: Medieval myths are currently being studied in the field of Japanese literature, but consideration is rarely given to them in the field of mythology.
Medieval myths are currently being studied in the field of Japanese literature, but consideration is rarely given to them in the field of mythology.
Medieval myths are currently being studied in the field of Japanese literature, but rarely are they studied in the research field of mythology.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 近世になると、伊勢国出身の本居宣長が、古事記に対して本格的解明を目指し名著『古事記伝』を書き上げ、『日本書紀』優位の神話が一変して、『古事記』優位の神話が主体となり、現在にいたっている。
sen.e: In the early modern age, with an aim to interpret the Kojiki in detail, Norinaga MOTOORI from Ise Province wrote his masterpiece, "Kojikiden" (Commentaries on the Kojiki), and the "Nihon Shoki"-dominated mythology changed to "The Kojiki"-dominated mythology, and the trend continues to this day.

In the early modern age, with an aim to interpret the Kojiki in detail, Norinaga MOTOORI from Ise Province wrote his masterpiece, "Kojikiden" (Commentaries on the Kojiki), and the "Nihon Shoki"-dominated mythology changed to "The Kojiki"-dominated mythology, and the trend continues to this day.

In the early modern age, with an aim to interpret the Kojiki in detail, Norinaga MOTOORI from Ise Province wrote his masterpiece, "Kojikiden" (Commentaries on the Kojiki), and the "Nihon Shoki"-dominated mythology changed to "The Kojiki"-dominated mythology, and the trend continues to this day.

sen.j: また、少数派ではあるものの、キリシタンや幕末の新興宗教の教説にも日本独自の神話がみられる。
sen.e: Furthermore, although small in number, myths unique to Japan can be seen in the preaching in Christianity as well as in untraditional religions of the end of the Edo Period.
Furthermore, although small in number, myths unique to Japan can be seen in the preaching in Christianity as well as in untraditional religions of the end of the Edo Period.
Furthermore, although small in number, myths unique to Japan can be seen in the preachings of Christianity as well as in the non-traditional religions of the end of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 以上を踏まえた上で、この記事においては『古事記』、『日本書紀』などにより語られる「高天原神話」（記紀神話）に絞り、日本神話として解説を加えていくことにする。
sen.e: With the above in mind, this article will include an explanation of Japanese mythology with a focus on 'Takamanohara Mythology' (Kiki mythology) mentioned in "The Kojiki" and "Nihon Shoki."
With the above in mind, this article will include an explanation of Japanese mythology with a focus on 'Takamanohara Mythology' (Kiki mythology) mentioned in "The Kojiki" and "Nihon Shoki."
With the above in mind, this article will include an explanation of Japanese mythology with a focus on 'Takamanohara Mythology' (Kiki mythology) mentioned in "The Kojiki" and "Nihon Shoki."

sen.j: なお、「高天原神話」に登場するおもな神々はヤマト王権ひいては現在の天皇家の祖先に当たると記述されている。
sen.e: The main gods that appear in 'Takamanohara Mythology' are described as the ancestors of Yamato sovereigns, and consequently, of the present-day Imperial family.
The main gods that appear in 'Takamanohara Mythology' are described as the ancestors of Yamato sovereigns, and consequently, of the present-day Imperial family.
The main gods that appear in 'Takamanohara Mythology' are described as the ancestors of Yamato sovereigns, and consequently, of the present-day Imperial Family.

sen.j: これは、ヤマト王権の拡大にともない、各地方土着の神に対する崇敬を天皇に対するものに転化させ、初穂献上としての租税の徴収を容易にするためと推察されているが、そのため、時代により当時の権力者に都合の良い解釈がなされたり改変が加えられたりした経緯がある。
sen.e: It is inferred that this was done so to divert the reverence toward the native gods of the local regions to that toward the Emperor in order to facilitate tax collection in the form of presenting of the first rice harvest, and therefore, depending on the specific period, alterations and interpretations convenient to the authority at the time and were added to the mythology.

It is inferred that this was done so to divert the reverence toward the native gods of the local regions to that toward the Emperor in order to facilitate tax collection in the form of presenting of the first rice harvest, and therefore, depending on the specific period, alterations and interpretations convenient to the authority at the time and were added to the mythology.

It is inferred that this was done so to divert the reverence toward the native gods of the local regions to that toward the Emperor in order to facilitate tax collection in the form of presenting of the first rice harvest, and therefore, depending on the specific period, alterations and interpretations convenient to the authority at the time were added to the mythology.

sen.j: 例えば、記紀の編纂自体に同時代の天武天皇・持統天皇朝の影響や朝廷・藤原氏などの恣意が加わった可能性が指摘されている。
sen.e: For example, it has been pointed out that there is a possibility that the editing of Kiki itself was influenced by the Court of Emperor Tenmu and Empress Jito, and that arbitrary opinions of the Imperial Court and the Fujiwara clan may have been included.

For example, it has been pointed out that there is a possibility that the editing of Kiki itself was influenced by the Court of Emperor Tenmu and Empress Jito, and that arbitrary opinions of the Imperial Court and the Fujiwara clan may have been included.

sen.j: 東京裁判後、明治以降太平洋戦争以前の日本においては国民に対し国家の正統性を喧伝するプロパガンダとして国家権力によっても利用されたとされている（皇国史観）。
sen.e: After Tokyo Tribunal of War Criminals, it is considered that the mythology was used by the government authority as a propaganda for advertising the legitimacy of the government to the people in post-Meiji and pre-Pacific War Japan (Kokoku Shikan (emperor-centered historiography based on Shintoism)).

After Tokyo Tribunal of War Criminals, it is considered that the mythology was used by the government authority as propaganda for advertising the legitimacy of the government to the people in post-Meiji and pre-Pacific War Japan (Kokoku Shikan (emperor-centered historiography based on Shintoism)).

Since the Tokyo Tribunal of War Criminals, it is considered that this was used by the government authority as propaganda for advertising the legitimacy of the government to the people in post-Meiji and pre-Pacific War Japan (Kokoku Shikan (emperor-centered historiography based on Shintoism)).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現在は、風土、風俗などの民俗学、考古学にもとづく研究などがおもにされている。
sen.e: Currently, research in mythology focuses mainly on archeological and ethnological approach, such as the environment and customs.
Currently, research in mythology focuses mainly on archeological and ethnological approach, such as the environment and customs.

sen.j: また、日本神話の原形となったと思われる逸話や、日本神話と類似点を持つ神話はギリシャ神話など世界中に多数存在する。
sen.e: Anecdotes that are considered to form the origins of Japanese mythology, and myths that share common features with Japanese mythology can be found in Greek mythology as well as in mythologies of many other countries.

sen.j: 日本における古墳期-奈良期にかけての国の勢力関係をも知る上での参考資料ともなっている。
sen.e: It serves as a reference information in understanding the political power balance among the provinces between the Tumulus Period and the Nara Period in Japan.
It serves as a reference information in understanding the political power balance among the provinces between the Tumulus Period and the Nara Period in Japan.

sen.j: その上でここでは、あくまでも神話として、或いは民俗学・考古学上の観点から、「高天原神話」について述べることにしたい。
sen.e: With that in mind, 'Takamanohara Mythology' will be mentioned here merely as myth, or alternatively, from the view point of archeology and ethnology.

sen.j: この記事では、日本神話のあらすじを述べるにとどめ、各神話の詳細は、別記事に譲る。
sen.e: In this article, only the outline of Japanese mythology is presented, and details of each myth should be found elsewhere.

tit.cmt: 文頭以外の語頭を小文字に

sen.j: 世界の最初に高天原で、別天津神・神世七代という神々が生まれた。
sen.e: Gods called Kotoamatsu kami (Separate Heavenly Gods) and Kaminoyonanayo (Seven Generations of the Gods' World, The Primordial Seven) were born in Takamanohara (Plain of High Heaven) at the beginning of the world.

Gods called Kotoamatsu kami (Separate Heavenly Gods) and Kaminoyonanayo (Seven Generations of the Gods' World, The Primordial Seven) were born in Takamanohara (Plain of High Heaven) at the beginning of the world.

Gods called Kotoamatsu kami (Separate Heavenly Gods) and Kaminoyonanayo (Seven Generations of the Gods' World, The Primordial Seven) were born in Takamanohara (Plain of High Heaven) at the beginning of the world.

sen.j: これらの神々の最後に生まれてきたのがイザナギ・イザナミである。
sen.e: The last of these gods born were Izanagi and Izanami.
The last of these gods born were Izanagi and Izanami.
The last of these gods born were Izanagi and Izanami.

sen.j: イザナギ・イザナミは葦原中国に降り、結婚して大八洲と呼ばれる日本列島を形成する島々を次々と生み出していった。
sen.e: Izanagi and Izanami descended on Ashihara no nakatsukuni (Central Land of Reed Plains, which refers to the human world), married each other and created one island after another that formed the Japanese Islands known as Oyashima.

Izanagi and Izanami descended on Ashihara no nakatsukuni (Central Land of Reed Plains, which refers to the human world), married each other and created one island after another that formed the Japanese Islands known as Oyashima.

Izanagi and Izanami descended on Ashihara no nakatsukuni (Central Land of Reed Plains, which refers to the human world), married each other and created one island after another that formed the Japanese Islands known as Oyashima.

sen.j: さらに、さまざまな神々を生み出していったが、火の神カグツチを出産した際にイザナミはカグツチの火にホト（性器）を焼かれたのがもとで病となり死んでしまい、出雲と伯耆の境の比婆の山（現；島根県安来市）に埋葬された。
sen.e: Furthermore, they created various gods, but when Izanami gave birth to fire god, Kagutsuchi, her genitals got burnt, and because of that she became ill and died, and she was buried at Mt. Hiba (present-day Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture) located at the border between Izumo and Hoki.

Furthermore, they created various gods, but when Izanami gave birth to fire god, Kagutsuchi, her genitals got burnt, and because of that she became ill and died, and she was buried at Mt. Hiba (present-day Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture) located at the border between Izumo and Hoki.

Furthermore, they created various gods, but when Izanami gave birth to fire god, Kagutsuchi, her genitals got burnt, and because of that she became ill and died, and she was buried at Mt. Hiba (present-day Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture) located at the border between Izumo and Hoki.

sen.j: イザナギはカグツチを殺し、イザナミをさがしに黄泉の国へと赴く。
sen.e: Izanagi killed Kagutsuchi and he set off to the underworld to look for Izanami.
Izanagi killed Kagutsuchi and he set off to the underworld to look for Izanami.
Izanagi killed Kagutsuchi and he set off to the underworld to look for Izanami.

sen.j: しかし、黄泉の国のイザナミは既に変わり果てた姿になっていた。
sen.e: However, in the underworld, Izanami was hardly recognizable.
However, in the underworld, Izanami was hardly recognizable.
However, in the underworld, Izanami was already dead and had changed beyond recognition.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これにおののいたイザナギは逃げた。
sen.e: Izanagi got scared and fled.
Izanagi became scared and fled.
Izanagi became scared and fled.

sen.j: イザナギは黄泉のケガレを嫌って禊をした。
sen.e: Izanagi despised the impurity of the underworld and he cleansed himself.
Izanagi despised the impurity of the underworld and cleansed himself.
Izanagi despised the impurity of the underworld and cleansed himself.

sen.j: この時もさまざまな神々が生まれた。
sen.e: Various gods were also born on this occasion.
Various gods were also born on this occasion.
Various gods were also born on this occasion.

sen.j: 左目を洗ったときに生まれた神が天照大神（日の神、高天原を支配）・右目を洗ったときにツクヨミ（月の神、夜を支配）・鼻を洗ったときにスサノオ（海原を支配）が成り、この三柱の神は三貴子と呼ばれ、イザナギによって世界の支配を命じられた。
sen.e: God that was born when he cleansed his left eye was Amaterasu Omikami (the sun goddess, rules Takamanohara), when he washed the right eye Tsukuyomi (the moon goddess, rules the night) was created, and when he washed his nose Susanoo (rules the sea) was created, and these gods are collectively called Mihashira no uzuno miko (The Three Noble Children), and they were ordered to rule the world by Izanagi.

God that was born when he cleansed his left eye was Amaterasu Omikami (the sun goddess, rules Takamanohara), when he washed the right eye Tsukuyomi (the moon goddess, rules the night) was created, and when he washed his nose Susanoo (rules the sea) was created, and these gods are collectively called Mihashira no uzuno miko (The Three Noble Children), and they were ordered to rule the world by Izanagi.

God that was born when he cleansed his left eye was Amaterasu Omikami (the sun goddess, rules Takamanohara), when he washed the right eye Tsukuyomi (the moon goddess, rules the night) was created, and when he washed his nose Susanoo (rules the sea) was created, and these gods are collectively called Mihashira no uzuno miko (The Three Noble Children), and they were ordered to rule the world by Izanagi.

tit.j: アマテラスとスサノオ

sen.j: スサノオはイザナミのいる根の国へ行きたいと泣き叫び、天地に甚大な被害を与えた。
sen.e: Susanoo wailed because he wanted to go to the underworld where Izanami was, and he caused an extensive damage to the heaven and the earth.
Susanoo wailed because he wanted to go to the underworld where Izanami was, and he caused extensive damage to heaven and earth.
Susanoo wailed because he wanted to go to the underworld where Izanami was, and he caused extensive damage to heaven and earth.

sen.j: そして、アマテラスの治める高天原へと登っていく。
sen.e: Then, he went up to Takamanohara ruled by Amaterasu.
Then, he went up to Takamanohara ruled by Amaterasu.
Then, he went up to Takamanohara ruled by Amaterasu.

sen.j: アマテラスはスサノオが高天原を奪いに来たのかと勘違いし、弓矢を携えてスサノオを迎えた。
sen.e: Amaterasu thought Susanoo came to take over Takamanohara, so she greeted Susanoo with her bow and arrow ready.
Amaterasu thought Susanoo came to take over Takamanohara, so she greeted Susanoo with her bow and arrow ready.
Amaterasu thought Susanoo came to take over Takamanohara, so she greeted Susanoo with her bow and arrow ready.

sen.j: スサノオはアマテラスの疑いを解くために各の身につけている物などで子（神）を産み、その性別によりスサノオは身の潔白を証明した。
sen.e: In order to disprove Amaterasu's suspicion, Amaterasu and Susanoo created gods with what each other was wearing, and by the gender of the gods Susanoo proved his innocence.
In order to disprove Amaterasu's suspicion, Amaterasu and Susanoo created gods with what each other was wearing, and Susanoo proved his innocence through their gender.
In order to disprove Amaterasu's suspicion, Amaterasu and Susanoo created gods with what each other was wearing, and the gender of the gods proved Susanoo's innocence.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これによりアマテラスはスサノオを許したが、スサノオが高天原で乱暴を働いたためアマテラスは天岩戸に隠れた。
sen.e: Amaterasu forgave Susanoo, but because Susanoo showed a violent behavior in Takamanohara, Amaterasu hid herself in Amano iwado (Cave of Heaven).
Amaterasu forgave Susanoo, but because Susanoo showed violent behavior in Takamanohara, Amaterasu hid herself in Amano iwado (Cave of Heaven).
Amaterasu forgave Susanoo, but because Susanoo showed violent behavior in Takamanohara, Amaterasu hid herself in Amano iwado (Cave of Heaven).

sen.j: 日の神であるアマテラスが隠れてしまったために太陽が出なくなってしまい神々は困った。
sen.e: Because Amaterasu, sun goddess, hid herself the sun did not rise anymore, and that became a problem for the gods.
Because Amaterasu, sun goddess, hid herself the sun did not rise anymore, and this became a problem for the gods.
Because Amaterasu, sun goddess, hid herself the sun did not rise anymore, and this became a problem for the gods.

sen.j: そこで、計略でアマテラスを天岩戸から出した。
sen.e: They came up with a plan and got Amaterasu out of Amano iwado.
They came up with a plan and got Amaterasu out of Amano iwado.
They came up with a plan and got Amaterasu out of Amano iwado.

sen.j: スサノオは下界に追放された。
sen.e: Susanoo was expelled to the lower world.
Susanoo was expelled to the lower world.
Susanoo was expelled to the lower world.

sen.j: スサノオは出雲国に降り立った。
sen.e: Susanoo descended in Izumo Province.
Susanoo descended in Izumo Province.
Susanoo descended in Izumo Province.

sen.j: そして、害獣であるヤマタノオロチ（八俣遠呂智）を切り殺し、クシナダヒメと結婚する。
sen.e: He then slew Yamatano orochi (eight-headed and eight-tailed giant snake), a monster, and he married Kushinadahime.
He then slew Yamatano orochi (eight-headed and eight-tailed giant snake), a monster, and married Kushinadahime.
He then slew Yamatano orochi (eight-headed and eight-tailed giant snake), a monster, and married Kushinadahime.

sen.j: スサノオの子孫である大国主はスセリビメと結婚し、スクナビコナと葦原中国の国づくりを始めた。
sen.e: Susanoo's descendant, Okuninushi, married Suseribime and began to create Ashihara no Nakatsukuni with Sukunabikona.
Susanoo's descendant, Okuninushi, married Suseribime and began to create Ashihara no Nakatsukuni with Sukunabikona.
Susanoo's descendant, Okuninushi, married Suseribime and began to create Ashihara no Nakatsukuni with Sukunabikona.

sen.j: 出雲神話とはいうものの、これらの説話は『出雲国風土記』には収録されていない。
sen.e: Even though these stories are called Izumo Mythology they are not included in "Izumo no kuni fudoki" (Ancient records of culture and the land of Izumo Province).
Even though these stories are called Izumo Mythology they are not included in "Izumo no kuni fudoki" (Ancient records of culture and the land of Izumo Province).
Even though these stories are called Izumo Mythology they are not included in "Izumo no kuni fudoki" (Ancient records of culture and the land of Izumo Province).

sen.j: ただし、神名は共通するものが登場する。
sen.e: However, similar names of the gods appear in it.
However, similar names of the gods appear in it.
However, similar names of the gods appear in it.

sen.j: アマテラスら高天原にいた神々（天津神）は、葦原中国を統治するべきなのは天津神、とりわけアマテラスの子孫だとした。
sen.e: Gods of Takamanohara (Amatsu kami), such as Amaterasu, asserted that Amatsu kami, especially Amaterasu's descendants, should rule Ashihara no Nakatsukuni.
Gods of Takamanohara (Amatsu kami), such as Amaterasu, asserted that Amatsu kami, especially Amaterasu's descendants, should rule Ashihara no Nakatsukuni.
Gods of Takamanohara (Amatsu kami), such as Amaterasu, asserted that Amatsu kami, especially Amaterasu's descendants, should rule Ashihara no Nakatsukuni.

sen.j: そのため、何人かの神を出雲に使わした。
sen.e: Therefore, she sent several gods to Izumo.
Therefore, she sent several gods to Izumo.
Therefore, she sent several gods to Izumo.

sen.j: 大国主の子である事代主・タケミナカタが天津神に降ると大国主も大国主のための宮殿建設と引き換えに、天津神に国を譲ることを約束する。
sen.e: When Okuninushi's son, Kotoshiro nushi (an ancient Japanese god) Takeminakata, descended on Amatsu kami, Okuninushi also promised to Amatsu kami that he would protect the country in exchange for the palace that was built for Okuninushi.
sen.cmt: 「タケミナカタが天津神に降ると」意味不明
sen.e: When Okuninushi's son, Kotoshiro nushi (an ancient Japanese god) Takeminakata, descended on Amatsu kami, Okuninushi also promised to Amatsu kami that he would protect the country in exchange for the palace that was built for Okuninushi.
When Okuninushi's son, Kotoshiro nushi Takeminakata, descended on Amatsu kami, Okuninushi also promised to Amatsu kami that he would hand over the country in exchange for a palace built for himself.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この宮殿は後の出雲大社である。
sen.e: This palace later became Izumo-taisha Shrine.
This palace later became Izumo-taisha Shrine.
This palace later became Izumo-taisha Shrine.

sen.j: アマテラスの孫であるニニギが葦原中国平定を受けて日向国に降臨した。
sen.e: Amaterasu's grandson, Ninigi, unified Ashihara no Nakatsukuni, and descended in Hyuga Province.
Amaterasu's grandson, Ninigi, unified Ashihara no Nakatsukuni, and descended in Hyuga Province.
Amaterasu's grandson, Ninigi, unified Ashihara no Nakatsukuni, and descended in Hyuga Province.

sen.j: ニニギはコノハナノサクヤビメと結婚した。
sen.e: Ninigi married Konohana no Sakuyabime.
Ninigi married Konohana no Sakuyabime.
Ninigi married Konohana no Sakuyabime.

sen.j: ニニギの子であるホデリ・ホオリは山幸彦が海幸彦の釣り針をなくしたことでけんかになった。
sen.e: Ninigi's children, Hoderi and Hoori, had a fight over Yamasachihiko losing Umisachihiko's fishing hook.
Ninigi's children, Hoderi and Hoori, had a fight over Yamasachihiko losing Umisachihiko's fishing hook.
Ninigi's children, Hoderi and Hoori, had a fight over Yamasachihiko losing Umisachihiko's fishing hook.

sen.j: 山幸彦は海神の宮殿に赴き、釣り針をみつけ、釣り針を返した。
sen.e: Yamasachihiko went to the palace of the god of the sea, found the fishing hook and returned it.
Yamasachihiko went to the palace of the god of the sea, found the fishing hook and returned it.
Yamasachihiko went to the palace of the god of the sea, found the fishing hook and returned it.

sen.j: 山幸彦は海神の娘と結婚しウガヤフキアエズという子をなした。
sen.e: Yamasachihiko married the daughter of the god of the sea and had a child named Ugayafukiazue.
Yamasachihiko married the daughter of the god of the sea and had a child named Ugayafukiazue.
Yamasachihiko married the daughter of the god of the sea and had a child named Ugayafukiaezu.

sen.j: ウガヤフキアエズの子がカムヤマトイワレヒコ（またはカンヤマトイワレヒコ。後の神武天皇）である。
sen.e: Ugayafukiazue's child was Kamuyamato iwarehiko (or Kanyamato Iwarehiko. He later became Emperor Jinmu).
Ugayafukiazue's child was Kamuyamato iwarehiko (or Kanyamato Iwarehiko. He later became Emperor Jinmu).
Ugayafukiaezu's child was Kamuyamato iwarehiko (or Kanyamato Iwarehiko. He later became Emperor Jinmu).

sen.j: カムヤマトイワレヒコは兄たちと謀って大和を支配しようともくろむ。
sen.e: Kamuyamato iwarehiko schemed with his older brothers to rule Yamato.
Kamuyamato iwarehiko schemed with his older brothers to rule Yamato.
Kamuyamato iwarehiko schemed with his older brothers to rule Yamato.

sen.j: ヤマトの先住者たちは果敢に抵抗し、カムヤマトイワレヒコも苦戦するが、結局、天孫のカムヤマトイワレヒコの敵ではなかった。
sen.e: Former inhabitants of Yamato defied and Kamuyamato iwarehiko struggled in his fight, but they were no match for Kamuyamato iwarehiko, who was a descendant of the sun goddess.
The former inhabitants of Yamato defied him and Kamuyamato iwarehiko struggled in his fight, but they were no match for Kamuyamato iwarehiko, who was a descendant of the sun goddess.
The former inhabitants of Yamato defied him and Kamuyamato iwarehiko struggled in his fight, but they were no match for Kamuyamato iwarehiko, who was a descendant of the sun goddess.

sen.j: カムヤマトイワレヒコは畝傍橿原宮の山麓で即位する。
sen.e: Kamuyamato iwarehiko was enthroned at the foot of the mountain at Unebi no kashihara no miya.
Kamuyamato iwarehiko was enthroned at the foot of the mountain at Unebi no kashihara no miya.
Kamuyamato iwarehiko was enthroned at the foot of the mountain at Unebi no kashihara no miya.

sen.j: これが初代天皇である神武天皇である。
sen.e: This was the very first emperor, Emperor Jinmu.
This was the very first emperor, Emperor Jinmu.
This was the very first emperor, Emperor Jinmu.

sen.j: 神武天皇の死後、神武天皇が日向にいたときの子であるタギシミミが反乱を起こす。
sen.e: After Emperor Jinmu died Tagishimimi, a son of Emperor Jinmu when he lived in Hyuga, started an uprising.
After Emperor Jinmu died Tagishimimi, a son of Emperor Jinmu when he lived in Hyuga, started an uprising.
After Emperor Jinmu died Tagishimimi, a son of Emperor Jinmu when he lived in Hyuga, started an uprising.

sen.j: 綏靖天皇がそれを破り、皇位を継ぐ。
sen.e: Emperor Suizei defeated him and succeeded to the throne.
Emperor Suizei defeated him and succeeded to the throne.
Emperor Suizei defeated him and succeeded to the throne.

sen.j: カムヌナカワミミは綏靖天皇となるが、綏靖天皇以下の8代の天皇の事跡は伝わっていない。
sen.e: Kamununakawamimi became Emperor Suizei, but there are no records of the 8 emperors after Emperor Suizei.
Kamununakawamimi became Emperor Suizei, but there are no records of the 8 emperors after Emperor Suizei.
Kamununakawamimi became Emperor Suizei, but there are no records of the 8 emperors after Emperor Suizei.

sen.j: 神話研究
sen.e: Research in Mythology
Research in Mythology
Research in Mythology

sen.j: 江戸時代までは官選の正史として記述された『日本書紀』の方が重要視され、『古事記』はあまり重視されていなかった。
sen.e: Until the Edo Period, "Nihon Shoki" was highly valued because it contains the official history edited by the government, but "The Kojiki" was not regarded to that extent.
Until the Edo Period, "Nihon Shoki" was highly valued because it contains the official history edited by the government, but "The Kojiki" was not regarded to that extent.
Until the Edo period, "Nihon Shoki" was highly valued because it contained the official history edited by the government, but "The Kojiki" was not.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 江戸中期以降、本居宣長の『古事記伝』など国学の発展によって、『日本書紀』よりも古く、かつ漢文だけでなく日本の言葉も混ぜて書かれた『古事記』の方が重視されるようになり、現在に至っている。
sen.e: Owing to the development of Japanese classical literature, such as Norinaga MOTOORI's "Kojikiden," after the mid-Edo Period "The Kojiki," which is older than "Nihon Shoki," and furthermore, written not only in classical Chinese but also with added Japanese words, became more highly regarded, and the trend continues to this day.

Owing to the development of Japanese classical literature, such as Norinaga MOTOORI's "Kojikiden," after the mid-Edo Period "The Kojiki," which is older than "Nihon Shoki," and furthermore, written not only in classical Chinese but also with added Japanese words, became more highly regarded, and the trend continues to this day.

With the development of studies on Japanese classical literature, such as Norinaga MOTOORI's "Kojikiden,"since the mid-Edo period, "The Kojiki,"became more highly regarded because it is older than "Nihon Shoki," and written not only in classical Chinese character text but also with Japanese words.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 明治以降は皇国史観によって日本神話の記述が神聖視され、神話研究はそれ以前よりも後退することとなった。
sen.e: After the Meiji Period, descriptions in Japanese mythology became deified due to Kokoku shikan, and the study of mythology regressed even further.
After the Meiji Period, descriptions in Japanese mythology became deified due to Kokoku shikan, and the study of mythology regressed even further.
After the Meiji period, descriptions in Japanese mythology were considered as the divine truth due to Kokoku shikan, and the study of mythology regressed even further.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 大正時代に津田左右吉が『神代史の新しい研究』ほかを発表し、日本神話に科学的な観点から批評をおこない、神代記は政治的な意図で作られた創作であると結論づけた。
sen.e: During the Taisho Period, Sokichi TSUDA published "Shindaishi no atarashii kenkyu" (New Research in the History of the Divine Age) and other works, in which he criticized the Japanese mythology from scientific view point, and concluded that Shindaiki (Records of the Age of the Gods) was a creation with a political intent.

During the Taisho Period, Sokichi TSUDA published "Shindaishi no atarashii kenkyu" (New Research in the History of the Divine Age) and other works, in which he criticized the Japanese mythology from scientific view point, and concluded that Shindaiki (Records of the Age of the Gods) was a creation with a political intent.

During the Taisho period, Sokichi TSUDA published "Shindaishi no atarashii kenkyu" (New Research in the History of the Divine Age) and other works, in which he criticized the Japanese mythology from scientific view point, and concluded that Shindaiki (Records of the Age of the Gods) was a creation with a political intent.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦前は不敬罪として弾圧されたが、戦後になって注目され、しばらくの間、津田の説が日本神話研究の中心となった。
sen.e: He was oppressed for lese majesty before the Second World War, but he drew attention after the war, and TSUDA's theory became the center of the study of Japanese mythology for a while.
He was oppressed as the lese majesty before the Second World War, but he drew attention after the war, and TSUDA's theory became the center of the study of Japanese mythology for a while.

He was oppressed by being charged for defamation against royalty before the Second World War, but he drew attention after the war, and TSUDA's theory became the center of the study of Japanese mythology for a while.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現在では津田説が細部まで正しいとは必ずしも考えられてはいないが、日本神話を考古学などの証拠なく弥生・古墳時代の史的事実の反映と考える説は基本的に退けられている。
sen.e: Nowadays, the fine details of the Tsuda theory are not always considered to be correct, but the approach that views Japanese mythology as a reflection of historical facts from the Yayoi to the Tumulus Periods without archeological proof, is basically avoided.

Nowadays, the fine details of the Tsuda theory are not always considered to be correct, but the approach that views Japanese mythology as a reflection of historical facts from the Yayoi to the Tumulus Periods without archeological proof, is basically avoided.

Nowadays, the fine details of the Tsuda theory are not always considered to be correct, but the approach that views Japanese mythology as a reflection of historical facts from the Yayoi to the Tumulus periods without archeological proof, is basically avoided.

sen.j: 今日では意図的な改変や創作がかなり加えられてはいるが、そのようなものの見方をする古代の人たちがいたことに注目する文化的背景を考察する考え方が主流となっている。
sen.e: Even though an extensive amount of intentional alterations and fictions have been added, the main approach in the modern day is to observe the cultural background, which contributes to how the ancient people viewed the world.

Even though an extensive amount of intentional alterations and fictions were added, the main approach in the modern day is to observe the cultural background, and bring focus to these ancient people who viewed the world in this fashioin.

Even though an extensive amount of intentional alterations and fictions were added, the main approach in the modern day is to observe the cultural background, and bring focus to these ancient people who viewed the world in this fashio.

sen.j: 比較神話
sen.e: Comparative Mythology
Comparative Mythology
Comparative Mythology

sen.j: 日本神話の中には他の神話との関連性を指摘されているものが多く存在する。
sen.e: Among Japanese mythology, there exist many myths that are noted for being similar to other mythologies.
Among Japanese mythology, there exist many myths that are noted for being similar to other mythologies.
Among Japanese mythology, there exist many myths that are noted for being similar to other mythologies.

sen.j: ギリシャ神話におけるオルフェウスの黄泉の国行きと伊弉諾尊の黄泉の国行き、デメテルと天照大神が隠れると草花が枯れるなど多くの類似点がみられるといわれている（→死と再生の神）。
sen.e: It is said that many similarities can be seen in Greek mythology, such as Orpheus going to the underworld just as Izanagi went to the underworld, and plants and flowers withering when Demeter and Amaterasu hid themselves (god of death and regeneration).

It is said that many similarities can be seen in Greek mythology, such as Orpheus going to the underworld just as Izanagi went to the underworld, and plants and flowers withering when Demeter and Amaterasu hid themselves (god of death and regeneration).

It is said that many similarities can be seen in Greek mythology, such as Orpheus going to the underworld just as Izanagi went to the underworld, and plants and flowers withering when Demeter and Amaterasu hid themselves (god of death and regeneration).

sen.j: アポロンのカラスと八咫烏、中国の金烏は何れも太陽神の使い、元は白い、星図によっては烏座が3本足のものもあるなど類似性を指摘されている（3本足のカラスについては一説には太陽黒点の図形が起源ともいわれている）。
sen.e: Apollo's raven, yatagarasu (large, Japanese mythological crow) and Chinese kinu (crow) are all servants of sun gods, and similarities have been pointed out such as the birds being originally white in color, and constellation Corvus (crow) is depicted with 3 legs in some star charts (according to one view the pattern of the sun spots is said to be the origin of the three-legged crow).

Apollo's raven, yatagarasu (large, Japanese mythological crow) and Chinese kinu (crow) are all servants of sun gods, and similarities have been pointed out such as the birds being originally white in color, and constellation Corvus (crow) is depicted with 3 legs in some star charts (according to one view the pattern of the sun spots is said to be the origin of the three-legged crow).

Apollo's raven, yatagarasu (large, Japanese mythological crow) and Chinese kinu (crow) are all servants of sun gods, and similarities have been pointed out such as the birds being originally white in color, and constellation Corvus (crow) is depicted with 3 legs in some star charts (according to one view the pattern of the sun spots is said to be the origin of the three-legged crow).

sen.j: アレクサンドロス3世の説話と神武天皇の遠征と類似しているという説もある。
sen.e: There is a theory that states that there is a similarity between the legend of Alexander the Great and Emperor Jinmu's expedition.
There is a theory that states that there is a similarity between the legend of Alexander the Great and Emperor Jinmu's expedition.
There is a theory that states that there is a similarity between the legend of Alexander the Great and Emperor Jinmu's expedition.

sen.j: イザナギとイザナミは兄妹であるが、人類の始祖たる男女が兄妹であったとする神話は南アジアからポリネシアにかけて広くみられる。
sen.e: Izanami and Izanagi were siblings, but myths that have the first man and the first woman, who are the ancestors of human beings, as siblings can be found widely from South Asia to Polynesia.
Izanami and Izanagi were siblings, but myths that have the first man and the first woman, who are the ancestors of human beings, as siblings can be found widely from South Asia to Polynesia.
Izanami and Izanagi were siblings, but myths that have the first man and the first woman, who are the ancestors of human beings, as siblings can be found widely from South Asia to Polynesia.

sen.j: イザナミは「最初の死人」となり「死の国を支配する神」となったが、「最初の死人」が「死の国を支配する神」となる話は古代エジプトのオシリスやインドのヤマなどにみられる。
sen.e: Izanami was 'the first mortal to die' and she became 'the goddess that rules the underworld,' but stories in which 'the first mortal to die' becomes 'the god who rules the underworld' can be seen in Osiris of Ancient Egypt and in Yama of India.

Izanami was 'the first mortal to die' and she became 'the goddess that rules the underworld,' but stories in which 'the first mortal to die' becomes 'the god who rules the underworld' can be seen in Osiris of Ancient Egypt and in Yama of India.

Izanami was 'the first mortal to die' and she became 'the goddess that rules the underworld,' but stories in which 'the first mortal to die' becomes 'the god who rules the underworld' can be seen in Osiris of Ancient Egypt and in Yama of India.

sen.j: イザナギが黄泉の国から帰ってきたときに筑紫の日向にておこなった禊のときに左目を洗うとアマテラス（太陽）が、右目を洗うとツキヨミ（月）が誕生したという話の類似例としては、中国神話において創造神たる盤古の死体のうち左目が太陽に、右目が月に化生したとされる話が見られる。
sen.e: As an example of a story similar to that of how Amaterasu (sun) was born when Izanagi washed his left eye and how Tsukiyomi (moon) was born when he washed his right eye when he performed a purification ritual in Hyuga in Tsukushi after he came back from the underworld, there is a story in Chinese mythology, in which the left eye became the sun and the right eye became the moon from Creator Pangu's corps.

As an example of a story similar to that of how Amaterasu (sun) was born when Izanagi washed his left eye and how Tsukiyomi (moon) was born when he washed his right eye when he performed a purification ritual in Hyuga in Tsukushi after he came back from the underworld, there is a story in Chinese mythology, in which the left eye became the sun and the right eye became the moon from Creator Pangu's corps.

As an example of a story similar to that of how Amaterasu (sun) was born when Izanagi washed his left eye and how Tsukiyomi (moon) was born when he washed his right eye at a purification ritual in Tsukushi, Hyuga after he came back from the underworld, there is a story in Chinese mythology, in which the left eye became the sun and the right eye became the moon from Creator Pangu's corpse.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 因幡の白兎が海を渡るのにサメを騙して利用する話があるが、動物が違えど似た内容の昔話が南方の島にある。
sen.e: There is a story of a white rabbit of Inaba, who tricked sharks and used them in order to get across the sea, and there are folktales in southern islands whose contents are similar but with different animals.

There is a story of a white rabbit of Inaba, who tricked sharks and used them in order to get across the sea, and there are folktales in southern islands whose contents are similar but with different animals.
